title.rendered: Best CMS for Mobile Apps: Choose the Right One

content.rendered:
Choosing the right CMS for mobile apps among so many content management systems in the market can be a daunting task. But making this decision correctly is going to have a great impact which will determine the success of your online presence. Before launching an app a developer should decide on a CMS which is just as functional as a website. It must have a user-friendly interface with a backend of the app. Besides developers online stores, content publishers and non-developers can work on this digital platform. Through CMS for mobile apps content publishers can deliver content across multiple channels.

In this blog, I will write about some of the best CMS for mobile apps. By the end of this, you will know which CMS is suitable for you. So, let’s begin.

What is a CMS? 

A CMS or content management system is one kind of web application or software that enables users to create, edit, organize, or publish digital content on the web. If you are not a tech person, don’t worry; CMS is there to assist you with your content creation. With CMS one doesn’t require extensive technical expertise to manage their web content, CMS will do the job for you.

CMS for mobile apps

Now let’s discuss CMS for mobile apps. CMS for mobile apps is an application that is used to create and manage digital content for mobile apps. There are a few CMSs that manage content for mobile applications and devices. It has faster media loading time.  You can take part in publishing and modifying your latest content through CMS for mobile apps without coding.

Types of CMS for mobile apps

1. Open-Source CMS

Open-source CMS is editable and available for the public. Online communities can easily update them. To operate an open source CMS a development team and third-party resources are required. It is reasonable but difficult to handle without IT support.

2. API first CMS

Also known as headless CMS for mobile apps. One can deliver content across multiple channels through this. It is designed for developing mobile app CMS. There is a built-in database to archive contents. 

3. MBaaS (Mobile Backend as a Service)

Mobile backend as a service (MBaaS) is quite popular among developers for delivering content. Your app will work on any operating system. With cloud computing, you can connect applications and resources. Customization is available.

4. Web-based CMS

A web-based CMS for mobile allows its users to publish and deliver their content mainly through an online platform that’s optimized for use on mobile devices. It provides a mobile-friendly admin interface while making sure the content management system runs with ease from smartphones and tablets. 

Top 8 CMS for Mobile Apps

The popularity of CMS for mobile apps is on the rise. Therefore selecting the right CMS that fulfills your app’s needs is imperative.

6Valley

Run your eCommerce business smoothly with single and multi vendor supported  6Valley CMS. Through this multi vendor solution, businessmen can maintain and sustain their online business. It offers a range of features and a comprehensive solution to grow any business. 6Valley provides customization through personalized options. 

Admins and stores using this platform can publish and manage content across multiple channels. Multimedia content such as images, videos, and various documents are easy to upload and organize. Customization is available. Developers who are looking to build and manage advanced-quality mobile applications can use 6Valley CMS without hesitation.

Features

  • Product Management: Through product management, the admin can categorize products in categories in an organized manner. There’s also a product gallery to store all the product information. Vendors can accept new product requests, he can also add new products and keep track of existing ones.
  • Customization: It provides a user-friendly interface with customizable themes to match the business demand. With the system setting admin can upload a new theme or keep the default one. Refreshing designs and compatible themes enhance users’ experience.
  • Order Management: 6Valley keeps tabs on all types of orders in real-time which ensures increased functionality. It tracks order status from the point an order is placed to the point it’s delivered. Push notifications help to keep customers, deliverymen, and stores updated about placed orders.
  • Mobile responsiveness: 6Valley is mobile responsive. The layout is adapted to cross-platforms. The design of this platform is mobile-optimized. It is available for both iOS and Android.

Pricing:
6Valley is available for only $79.

Get 6Valley

Contentful

With multitudes of features, this cloud-native headless CMS offers developers and content editors a platform to create and deliver content seamlessly. Its agility makes it impressive to use for both developers and non-developers alike. This API-first CMS offers way more features compared to traditional CMS enhancing user experiences, allowing users to connect with different devices and platforms.

Features

  • Secure Previews: Users can securely preview drafts and entries without disrupting published content.
  • Customizable Interface for Editor: For moderating different content, contentful provides a customizable UX. It also ensures flexible searchability through manageable tabs.
  • Archiving Feature:  You can retire content that was once live and can not be deleted by safely archiving them. It secures them from going live again by mistake.
  • Agile eCommerce: By creating personalized experiences Contentful empowers organizations across different platforms. It offers easy integration with eCommerce platforms to maintain digital requirements.

Pricing:
The basic package is available for $300 per month. It’s free for developers to build unique projects. 

Contentstack

Agile and effortless CMS even for those without any technical insights. It empowers enterprises via managing content across multiple channels. This CXP (Customer Experience Platform) is supporting businesses to create, manage, and distribute content with great flexibility. Makes personalized interaction between businesses and customers possible. Its agility makes it easily operable. Contentstack allows businesses to deliver personalized content across multiple channels.

Features

  • Content Modeling: With easy content modeling one can compose their digital properties in a structured way. Constructing different contents has become more effortless. By replacing the old drag-and-drop design it has introduced more whitespace, making it a cleaner interface. You can add new fields just by clicking the “+” icon.
  • GraphQL API: API which incorporates GraphQL API ensuring the client can request and get the data they asked for.

Pricing:
Pricing plans begin from $995.00 per month.

Core dna

It combines integration capabilities, personalization, and marketing automation in one unified solution. In short, it is a digital solution for mobile apps with the combination of content management, eCommerce, intranet, and marketing all in one platform.

Features 

  • Multilingual Content: Content in different languages is offered to reach a broader range of audience. This feature is appealing especially for global users making it easily accessible and comprehensible.
  • Scheduled Content: Scheduling content ahead of time along with modifying and publishing content beforehand comes as a privilege for content creators.
  • Media Library: You can store your digital properties such as images, videos, and audio files all in one place. It is easy to find and access desired files without any hassle. It also ensures security.

Pricing:
Core dna CMS price starts from $1250 per month.

Kentico

This cloud-first headless CMS with its separated front-end and back-end allows you to choose any tech stack of your choice for the front end. It provides an intuitive interface to create content. Customization of contents, tracking features, scalability, and high performance make it an ideal CMS.

Features 

  • Structured Content: Content writers without technical skills can create reusable content with structured data. Save time with predefined content types while allocating more time for content creation.
  • Digital Asset Management: It lets one maintain their digital properties such as videos, images, and presentations in one place. Regardless of the uploading channel you can display and access your digital assets without any error with the media library.
  • Multilingual Advantage: One can have effective interactions with the target audience and reach to different range of users including local to global audiences by creating content in multiple languages and generating more traffic while ensuring a seamless user experience.
  • Custom Tags: With custom tags filtering becomes convenient. Special tags enable advanced searching. This facilitates an organized content library.

Pricing:
The monthly price begins from $2,050 for the Standard tier.

dotCMS

An open source CMS that combines both traditional and headless CMS functionalities and provides scalability and integration with different technologies. It allows you to manage content across multiple platforms and devices. It offers a user-friendly interface for content creation while maintaining smooth workflow management. dotCMS enables you to ensure a personalized experience for users.

Features 

  • Personalization: For attracting more users personalization is a key factor. With dotCms, one gets personalization support. Each user gets content tailored to their needs which scales user conversion and ensures satisfaction.
  • Environment Support: From the testing environment to the developing environment, it provides different scopes. It also supports local setup and cloud-based infrastructure which ensure smooth CMS management. 

Pricing:
Open source version is free.

Sanity

It’s a headless CMS with reusability that incorporates structured content across multiple channels. Easily connectable to third-party technology, front-end framework, and data source. It offers a real-time data store to store structured content. Easy customization allows personalized experience.

Features 

  • Omnichannel: Easy integration with multiple channels such as apps, websites, mobile, and eCommerce.
  • Scheduling: You can schedule your content to publish at a fixed time according to your needs. This feature makes content publication more flexible.
  • Scalability: It empowers you to push limitations, to grow with business by offering real-time collaboration. Scalability increases customer acquisition speed.

Pricing:
For smaller projects pricing is free.

Strapi

Open source headless CMS which allows content delivery through APIs. provides customization and flexibility along with structured content for content creators to maintain the content management system.

Features

  • Customization of Contents: With Strapi, tailored complex content can be created in a flexible manner while defining structure and data fields as per one’s requirement.
  • User Authentication: With a built-in authentication feature and role management feature, Strapi provides permission to control access options along with the user.
  • Customizable API: Strapi allows control over API endpoints, empowering designers to retrieve data and moderate methods as per their needs.

Pricing:
The most popular package is available for a flat fee of $99 per month. The self-hosted package is free for life.

How to Choose the Best CMS for Your Mobile Apps

The chosen CMS must be open to omnichannel and different technologies that are popular among audiences these days. For better insights be advised to compare, contrast, and request demos to take an in-depth look into the industry. Now here are some tips on how you can choose the best CMS for your mobile apps:

1. Choose Microservice architecture over monolithic architecture. Companies need to strive for a micro service architecture. Why choose micro service architectures? They are resilient and easy to upgrade, modify, and manage.

2. Lean towards Content reusability. Reuse content across different channels at reduced costs. Publishing content repeatedly through different channels improves content consistency.

3. It should be Framework Agnostic. Among various mobile app development frameworks five most popular are given below

  • React Native
  • Flutter
  • Ionic
  • PhoneGap
  • Xamarin

4. Content writers and editors must be comfortable to interact with the chosen CMS.

5. Choose a CMS with a responsive design and user-friendly interface. Mobile compatibility is really important. The features of the CMS should be compatible with different mobile platforms.

6. Customization option is the key. Choose the CMS which offers customization options that will help you with making distinctive content, allowing you to change color, fonts, layout, and other components.

7. It must be secured. Find the CMS that can safeguard your content from unauthorized sources.

8. Last but not least choosing the CMS that is tailored to your needs and fits your budget is imperative. 

Also Read: 16 Best eCommerce CMS Platforms to Build Your Online Store

Conclusion

The right CMS for mobile apps should have scalability, a set of user-friendly features, strong security, and convenient pricing which will fulfill your needs. These attributes make them the top pick for both developers and creators. The best-suited CMS must manage your content successfully. You have to choose a CMS that can operate with great agility and can contend effectively in a competitive marketplace.

6Valley CMS, Contentful, Contentstack, Core dna, Kentico Kontent, dotCMS, Sanity, and Strapi are some of the best CMS for mobile apps out there that I have mentioned in this blog.  Selecting the right CMS is a complex task so after reading this blog I hope you will be well informed to make the right decision to find the correct fit for your digital venture.

FAQs

1. What is CMS?

A CMS or Content Management System is a software through which users can create, edit, organize, or publish content on the web. 

2. What is a Web-based CMS?

A web-based Content Management System allows users to maintain web content without requiring any programming skills

3. What is CMS for Mobile Apps? 

A CMS for mobile apps is designed to create and manage digital content for mobile apps.
